sources.title: SabotageImageQualityUpgrade
sources.description: This print is much sharper and cleaner than the existing IA copies. Another outstanding suspense thriller from Hitchcock's British years. If it isn't as popular as "The 39 Steps" or "The Lady Vanishes," it's probably because it's mounted on a smaller scale than those well-known classics. It also has a plot element some audiences found disturbing. Based on Joseph Conrad's novel, "The Secret Agent." Directed by Alfred Hitchcock. UK release 1936. US release 1937. a.k.a. "I Married a Murderer," "A Woman Alone" and "The Hidden Power" Complete print. CAST NOTE: Sylvia Sidney is billed as Sylvia Sydney. Oskar Homolka is billed as Oscar Homolka. NOTE: "The 39 Steps" and "The Lady Vanishes" are also available here at IA.
